column2: Deus meus
column3: rèspice in me~; ¿~qụare me dereliqụìsti~? Longe a salúte mea vèrba delictórum meórum. ^ O God my God
column4: look upon me~; why hast thou forsaken me~? Far from my salvation are the words of my sins.

column2: et non exáŭdies
column3: et nòcte
column4: et non ad insapiènțiam mìchi. ^ O my God
column8: and it shall not be reputed as folly in me.

column2: laŭs Israhélis. ^ But thou dwellest in the holy place
column3: the praise of Israel.

column1: 5 ^ In te speravérunt patres nostri~; speravérunt
column2: et liberavìsti eos. ^ In thee have our fathers hoped~; they have hoped
column3: and thou hast delivered them.

column2: et salvi facti sunt~; in te speravérunt
column3: et non sunt confúsi. ^ They cried to thee
column4: and they were saved~; they trusted in thee

column2: et non hòmo~; oppróbrium hòminum
column3: et abjècțio plebis. ^ But I am a worm
column4: and no man~; the reproach of men
column5: and the outcast of the people.

column2: derisérunt me~; locúti sunt lábiîs
column3: et movérunt caput. ^ All they that saw me have laughed me to scorn~; they have spoken with the lips

column2: erìpiat eum~; salvum fáçiat eum
column3: qụóniam vùlt eum. ^ He hoped in the Lord
column4: let him deliver him~; let him save him

column1: 10 ^ Qụóniam tu es qụi extraxìsti me de vèntre~; spes mea ab ubèribus matris meaĕ. ^ For thou art he that hast drawn me out of the womb~; my hope from the breasts of my mother.
11 ^ In te projèctus sum ex útero~; de vèntre matris meaĕ Deus meus es tu~; ^ I was cast upon thee from the womb~; from my mother's womb thou art my God~;

column2: qụóniam tribuláțio pròxima est
column3: qụóniam non est qụi ádjuvet. ^ be not withdrawn from me
column5: for there is none to help me.

column1: 13 ^ Circumdedérunt me vìtuli mùlti~; taŭri pingụes obsedérunt me. ^ Many calves have surrounded me~; fat bulls have besieged me.

column2: sicut leo rápiens et rúģiens. ^ They have opened their mouths against me
column3: as a lion ravening and roaring.

column2: et dispèrsa sunt òmnia òssua mea. Factum est cor meum tamqụam cera liqụéscens in mèdio vèntris mei. ^ I am poured out like water
column3: and all my bones are scattered. My heart is become like wax melting in the midst of my bowels.

column2: et lingụa mea adháĕsit fáŭcibus meîs
column3: et in pùlverem mortis deduxìsti me. ^ My strength is dried up like a potsherd
column4: and my tongue hath cleaved to my jaws
column5: and thou hast brought me down into the dust of death.

column1: 17 ^ Qụóniam circumdedérunt me canes mùlti~; concìlium malignántium obsédit me. Fodérunt manûs meas et pèdes meos~; ^ For many dogs have encompassed me~; the council of the malignant hath besieged me. They have dug my hands and feet~;
18 ^ dinumeravérunt òmnia òssua mea. Ìpsi vero consideravérunt et inspexérunt me. ^ they have numbered all my bones. But they have looked and stared upon me.

column2: et super vestem meam misérunt sortem. ^ They parted my garments amongst them
column3: and upon my vesture they cast lots.

column1: 20 ^ Tu aŭtem Dòmine ne elongáverîs aŭxìlium tuum a me~; ad defensiónem meam cònspice. ^ But thou
column2: O Lord
column3: let not thy help be removed from me~; look towards my defence.

column2: Deus
column3: ánimam meam
column4: et de manu canis únicam meam. ^ Deliver
column7: and my only one from the hand of the dog.

column2: et a córnibus unicórnium humilitátem meam. ^ Save me from the lion's mouth
column3: and my lowness from the horns of the unicorns.

column1: 23 ^ Narrábo nomen tuum frátribus meîs~; in mèdio ecclésiaĕ laŭdábo te. ^ I will declare thy name to my brethren~; in the midst of the church will I praise thee.
24 ^ Qụi timétis Dòminum laŭdáte eum~; univèrsum semen Jacóbis glorificáte eum~; tìmeat eum omne semen Israhélis
column2: ^ Ye that fear the Lord
column3: praise him~; all ye the seed of Jacob
column4: glorify him~; let all the seed of Israel fear him

column2: nèqụe despèxit deprecațiónem páŭperis
column3: nec avèrtit fáçiem suam a me
column4: et qụum clamárem ad eum exaŭdívit me. ^ because he hath not slighted nor despised the supplication of the poor man
column5: neither hath he turned away his face from me
column6: and when I cried to him he heard me.

column1: 26 ^ Apud te laŭs mea in ecclésia magna~; vota mea reddem in conspèctu timèntium eum. ^ With thee is my praise in a great church~; I will pay my vows in the sight of them that fear him.

column2: et saturabùntur
column3: et laŭdábunt Dòminum qụi reqụírunt eum~; vivent corda eórum in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ The poor shall eat
column5: and they shall praise the Lord that seek him~; their hearts shall live for ever and ever.

column1: 28 ^ Reminiscèntur et convertèntur ad Dòminum univèrsi fines terraĕ
column2: et adorábunt in conspèctu ejus univèrsaĕ famíliaĕ ģèntium. ^ All the ends of the earth shall remember
column3: and shall be converted to the Lord
column4: and all the kindreds of the Gentiles shall adore in his sight.

column2: et ìpse dominábitur ģèntium. ^ For the kingdom is the Lord's
column3: and he shall have dominion over the nations.

column1: 30 ^ Manducavérunt et adoravérunt òmnes pingụes terraĕ~; in conspèctu ejus cadent òmnes qụi descèndunt in terram. ^ All the fat ones of the earth have eaten and have adored~; all they that go down to the earth shall fall before him.

column2: et semen meum sèrviet ìpsi. ^ And to him my soul shall live
column3: and my seed shall serve him.

column2: et adnunțiábunt caĕli justìțiam ejus pòpulo qụi nascétur
column3: qụem fecit Dòminus. ^ There shall be declared to the Lord a generation to come
column4: and the heavens shall show forth his justice to a people that shall be born
